Cittapātali：A tree in the Asurabhavana （S.v.238） which lives for a whole aeon．When the Asuras were pushed out of the deva-world into their present abode，it was the presence of this tree which revealed to them their where-about （J.i.202； SNA.ii.485； MA.i.476； DhA.i.272）．

It is said （DhA.i.280） that whenever the Cittapātali blossomed，the Asuras thought of the Pāricchattaka-tree which they had left behind in Tāvatimsa and started making preparations for a war against Sakka.
